{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, other vaccines can be given with the COVID-19 vaccine. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) states that COVID-19 vaccines can be administered simultaneously with other vaccines, such as the flu vaccine or the pneumococcal vaccine. It is important to note that different vaccines should be administered at different injection sites, preferably in different limbs, to minimize the risk of local reactions or confusion about the cause of any adverse events. Additionally, the CDC recommends waiting at least 14 days between receiving the COVID-19 vaccine and any other vaccines that are given as part of a series, such as the measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine or the hepatitis B vaccine.", "answer_choice": "A"}
